content.text:
# Timeline of piers of Los Angeles County

and the Rainbow Pier, Long Beach, California, linen-era postcard by Tichnor Bros., produced ]]
This is a timeline of piers of Los Angeles County, California, United States, including dates of construction and demolition, and notable events. This list does not currently cover piers and wharves of the Port of Los Angeles on San Pedro Bay or piers in neighboring Orange County (part of Los Angeles County until 1889) at Seal Beach, Laguna Beach, Huntington Beach, etc.
{| class="wikitable"
|+ Timeline of piers of Los Angeles County
|-
! Date !! Event
|-
| 1897 || Abbot Kinney and Francis Ryan build the first Ocean Park Pier.
|-
| May 1908
| Construction begins on the Santa Monica Municipal Pier
|-
|
|Santa Monica Municipal Pier opens to the public
|-
|  || 1912 Ocean Park pier fire destroys Fraser's Million Dollar Pier and several square blocks of Ocean Park
|-
|  || Long Beach pier auditorium disaster kills more than 30 people at the Pine Avenue Pier in Long Beach
|-
|  || 1915 Ocean Park pier fire damages Fraser's Ocean Park pier
|-
|1916
|Looff's Pleasure Pier and Santa Monica Looff Hippodrome constructed adjacent to Santa Monica Municipal Pier
|-
|  || Abbot Kinney pier fire
|-
|
| 1924 Ocean Park pier fire destroys Pickering's Pier, Lick's Dome Pier, and Fraser's Pier
|-
|
| New Ocean Park Pier opens to the public
|}
List of piers in Los Angeles County
* Abbot Kinney Pier
* Crystal Pier
* Dome Pier
* G. M. Jones Pier
* Million Dollar Pier
* Horseshoe Pier and Pavilion
* The Long Wharf
* Looff Pleasure Pier
* Newcomb Pier
* Pickering's Pleasure Pier
* Pine Avenue Pier
* Rainbow Pier
* Santa Monica Pier
* Santa Monica Municipal Pier
* Venice Pier
* Venice Fishing Pier
